Recipe.title: One and Only Ham Glaze
Recipe.titleNote: Or "Ransom's A Ham Glaze" where "Ransom's" means "Ransom is"
Recipe.Source: From the kitchen of Karla Therriault
Recipe.Description: When you bake a ham, it turns out better if it has a glaze covering the outside. When Di tasted this one, she decided it was the one and only that we will use at home.

section.title: Glaze Sauce
section.instruction: Place the Melted Butter and Brown Sugar in a bowl and mix well.
Add Garlic and Yello Mustard and mix well.
Add Orange Juice Concentrate and mix well.
Immediately pour the mixture on the Ham and use a brush to spread it over the Ham, the closer to the top of the Hame, the thicker.
Follow baking instructions for the Ham.

section.title: Baking Ham
section.description: In our case, "Follow baking instructions for the Ham." usually involves:
section.instruction: In a criss-cross pattern, lay several sheets of foil that are long enough to completely wrap around the Ham.
Set the Ham in the middle and fold up 1 layer of foil, but not fold it over.
Apply the Glaze to the Ham and immediately fold each layer the foil up and over securely.
Bake the Ham at the appropriate temperature for the appropriate amount of time until it is done.

Modifications.modification:
If your oven has a convection setting, at the end of cooking the ham, unwrap the foil, change to convection and turn up the heat to 425°.
This gives the glaze a flame-broiled appearance.
